intro: Lasiosiphon ornatus, commonly known as the ornate lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a scrambling vine with hairy stems and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the spring and summer months. Lasiosiphon ornatus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
